intro: Cephalaria balansae, commonly known as the Balansae cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cephalaria balansae is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
